javaslang.match

Class Matcher<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaslang.match.Matcher<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The result type of the Matcher expression.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,T>

    public final class Matcher<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,T>
    A better switch for Java. A Matcher is
    • an expression, i.e. the call of apply(Object) results in a value. In fact it is a Function.
    • able to match types
    • able to match values
    • lazily processes an object in the case of a match
    See Matchers for convenience methods creating a matcher.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T apply(java.lang.Object obj)
      Applies an object to this matcher.
      <S> Matcher<T> caze(java.util.function.Function<S,T> function)
      If the type of the object applied to this Matcher (see apply(Object)) is assignable to S, the given object is applied to function.
      <S> Matcher<T> caze(S prototype, java.util.function.Function<S,T> function)
      If the given prototype value is equal to the object applied to this Matcher (see apply(Object)), the object is applied to function.
      static <T> Matcher<T> create()
      Creates a Matcher.

        andThen, compose, identity

    • Method Detail

      • caze

        public <S> Matcher<T> caze(java.util.function.Function<S,T> function)
        If the type of the object applied to this Matcher (see apply(Object)) is assignable to S, the given object is applied to function.

        Use this method to match a type.

        Type Parameters:
        S - type of the object to be matched
        Parameters:
        function - A function which is applied to a matched object.
        Returns:
        this, the current instance of Matcher.

      • caze

        public <S> Matcher<T> caze(S prototype,
                           java.util.function.Function<S,T> function)
        If the given prototype value is equal to the object applied to this Matcher (see apply(Object)), the object is applied to function.

        Use this method to match a value and map it.

        Type Parameters:
        S - type of the prototype object
        Parameters:
        prototype - An object which matches by equality.
        function - A function which is applied to a matched object.
        Returns:
        this, the current instance of Matcher.

      • create

        public static <T> Matcher<T> create()
        Creates a Matcher. See also Matchers.
        Type Parameters:
        T - return type of the matcher function
        Returns:
        A Matcher instance of type Matcher<T>.

      • apply

        public T apply(java.lang.Object obj)
        throws MatchError
        Applies an object to this matcher.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,T>
        Parameters:
        obj - An object.
        Returns:
        The result when applying the given obj to the first matching case. If the case has a consumer, the result is null, otherwise the result of the underlying function or supplier.
        Throws:
        MatchError - if no Matcher case matches the given object.
